intro: Amaranthus tricolor var. splendens, commonly known as the colorful amaranth or tri-color amaranth, is a vibrant, annual herbaceous plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its striking, multicolored leaves that display shades of red, orange, and yellow, making it a popular ornamental plant. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that develop into fluffy, three-lobed seed heads. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often growing up to 1–2 meters in height. Its rapid growth and ability to reseed itself make it both a garden favorite and a potential weed in agricultural settings.
